title: How to Play Powder Game and Make Cool Stuff in It

steps.headline: Load the game on the official powder game website(Under Sources on this page).
You will see a black screen with a panel of elements at the bottom.
steps.description: To begin, click on one of the elements. Some elements, such as BLOCK, TORCH, and C-4 are static, which means they stay in the air. Other elements, like POWDER, SEED, and VIRUS are particulate and float to the ground upon spawning.

steps.headline: After selecting your element, hold down Mouse1 to spawn it.
You can use Mouse2 (Windows users) or Ctrl + Click (Mac Users) to spawn a secondary element.
steps.description:
You can also select a Mouse1 function and Mouse2 function and hold down both to spawn two elements at once. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/3c\/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-4.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/3\/3c\/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-4.jpg\/v4-394px-Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":350,"bigWidth":"394","bigHeight":"300","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Get creative!
steps.description:
You make make things such as trees, firework shows, bombs, mortars, grills, and guns. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f0\/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/f\/f0\/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-5.jpg\/v4-400px-Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"400","bigHeight":"300","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: You can adjust how the elements are viewed by clicking on the BG-Line under the grid button.
When player is selected, use the left and right arrow keys to move and the up key to jump.
steps.description: If your player's head is colored (unlike the normal skin color) use the down key to spawn that element. Remember, this only works with particulate elements.

steps.headline: If you want to share your creations with the world, you can make an account on Dan-ball's website.
steps.description:
However, uploads are limited to one creation per day, so choose wisely. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e6\/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-8.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/e\/e6\/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-8.jpg\/v4-388px-Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-8.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"388","bigHeight":"291","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>

text:
Load the game on the official powder game website(Under Sources on this page). You will see a black screen with a panel of elements at the bottom. To begin, click on one of the elements. Some elements, such as BLOCK, TORCH, and C-4 are static, which means they stay in the air. Other elements, like POWDER, SEED, and VIRUS are particulate and float to the ground upon spawning. After selecting your element, hold down Mouse1 to spawn it. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/bc/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-3.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/bc/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-3.jpg/v4-393px-Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":"393","bigHeight":"293","licensing":"

"} You can use Mouse2 (Windows users) or Ctrl + Click (Mac Users) to spawn a secondary element. You can also select a Mouse1 function and Mouse2 function and hold down both to spawn two elements at once. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/3c/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-4.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/3/3c/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-4.jpg/v4-394px-Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":350,"bigWidth":"394","bigHeight":"300","licensing":"

"} Get creative! You make make things such as trees, firework shows, bombs, mortars, grills, and guns. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f0/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/f/f0/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-5.jpg/v4-400px-Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"400","bigHeight":"300","licensing":"

"} You can adjust how the elements are viewed by clicking on the BG-Line under the grid button. When player is selected, use the left and right arrow keys to move and the up key to jump. If your player's head is colored (unlike the normal skin color) use the down key to spawn that element. Remember, this only works with particulate elements. If you want to share your creations with the world, you can make an account on Dan-ball's website. However, uploads are limited to one creation per day, so choose wisely. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/e6/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-8.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/e/e6/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-8.jpg/v4-388px-Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-8.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"388","bigHeight":"291","licensing":"

sentences: Load the game on the official powder game website(Under Sources on this page).
You will see a black screen with a panel of elements at the bottom.
To begin, click on one of the elements.
Some elements, such as BLOCK, TORCH, and C-4 are static, which means they stay in the air.
Other elements, like POWDER, SEED, and VIRUS are particulate and float to the ground upon spawning.
After selecting your element, hold down Mouse1 to spawn it.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/bc\/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-3.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/bc\/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-3.jpg\/v4-393px-Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":"393","bigHeight":"293","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} You can use Mouse2 (Windows users) or Ctrl + Click (Mac Users) to spawn a secondary element.
You can also select a Mouse1 function and Mouse2 function and hold down both to spawn two elements at once.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/3c\/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-4.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/3\/3c\/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-4.jpg\/v4-394px-Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":350,"bigWidth":"394","bigHeight":"300","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Get creative!
You make make things such as trees, firework shows, bombs, mortars, grills, and guns.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f0\/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/f\/f0\/Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-5.jpg\/v4-400px-Play-Powder-Game-and-Make-Cool-Stuff-in-It-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"400","bigHeight":"300","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} You can adjust how the elements are viewed by clicking on the BG-Line under the grid button.
When player is selected, use the left and right arrow keys to move and the up key to jump.
If your player's head is colored (unlike the normal skin color) use the down key to spawn that element.
Remember, this only works with particulate elements.
If you want to share your creations with the world, you can make an account on Dan-ball's website.
However, uploads are limited to one creation per day, so choose wisely.
